result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ngadah Belig Kamanda

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Attorney Ashley Fard

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Ashley, Br. 19.

Defendant Ngadah Belig Kamanda not in court.  Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Ngadah Belig Kamanda.  Prosecuting attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court does not revoke bail at this time and takes it under the advisement.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
filed.
filed.
filed.
filed.

Defendant Ngadah Belig Kamanda in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing. Defense recently appointed and request matter set for final pretrial and jury trial. Case adjourned, Branch 38. **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Ashley Fard; filed.
filed.

Defendant Ngadah Belig Kamanda in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for scheduling conference. Case to be transferred to Attorney Fard. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Ngadah Belig Kamanda in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith; both appear by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Rivera. Stipulation to the identification of the defendant agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court. Court took judicial notice of 13CF507. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.
received and filed.

Court ordered the cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ngadah Belig Kamanda in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont. Flaherty, Daniel T appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons received and filed
